class.name: Word.CustomXmlValidationError
class.description: Represents a single validation error in a Word.CustomXmlValidationErrorCollection object.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a custom XML validation error to load and read its properties

properties.name: errorCode
properties.description: Gets an integer representing the validation error in the CustomXmlValidationError object.

examples.description: Check if a custom XML part has validation errors and log the error code of the first validation error found.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Gets the name of the error in the CustomXmlValidationError object.If no errors exist, the property returns Nothing

examples.description: Check if a custom XML part has validation errors and display the name of the first error found, or show a message if no errors exist.

properties.name: node
properties.description: Gets the node associated with this CustomXmlValidationError object, if any exist.If no nodes exist, the property returns Nothing.

examples.description: Get the XML node associated with a validation error and display its base name in the console.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Gets the text in the CustomXmlValidationError object.

examples.description: Display all validation error messages from custom XML parts in the document to the console.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Gets the type of error generated from the CustomXmlValidationError object.

examples.description: Check if a custom XML validation error was manually created or automatically generated by the system
Delete the first validation error from a custom XML part to clear it from the error collection

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the error type and reason for the first custom XML validation error in the document

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Update multiple properties of a custom XML validation error object at once to configure its error details

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.CustomXmlValidationError object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.CustomXmlValidationErrorData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a custom XML validation error to a plain JavaScript object for logging or debugging purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a custom XML validation error object across multiple sync calls to safely access its properties after document changes occur.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Retrieve custom XML validation errors, process them, and then untrack them to free memory after use.
